verse_text: Therefore, Jehoshaphat was wealthy and very famous, and he was joined by affinity to Ahab

And after some years, he descended to him in Samaria. And upon his arrival, Ahab slaughtered very many sheep and oxen, for him and for the people who had arrived with him. And he persuaded him that he should ascend against Ramoth Gilead

And Ahab, the king of Israel, said to Jehoshaphat, the king of Judah, â€œCome with me to Ramoth Gilead.â€ And he answered him: â€œAs I am, so also are you. As your people are, so also are my people. And we will be with you in war.
And Jehoshaphat said to the king of Israel, â€œConsult, I beg you, the word of the Lord for the present circumstances.

And so the king of Israel gathered together four hundred men of the prophets, and he said to them: â€œShould we go to war against Ramoth Gilead, or should we be quieted?â€ But they said, â€œAscend, and God will deliver into the hand of the king.
And Jehoshaphat said, â€œIs there not a prophet of the Lord here, so that we may inquire of him as well?

And the king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat: â€œThere is one man, from whom we would be able to ask the will of the Lord. But I hate him, for he never prophesies good to me, but at all times evil. And it is Micaiah, the son of Imlah.â€ And Jehoshaphat said, â€œYou should not speak in this manner, O king.
Therefore, the king of Israel called one of the eunuchs, and said to him: â€œQuickly, summon Micaiah, the son of Imlah.

Now the king of Israel, and Jehoshaphat, the king of Judah, were both sitting upon their thrones, clothed in royal vestments. And they were sitting in an open area, beside the gate of Samaria. And all the prophets were prophesying before them
Truly, Zedekiah, the son of Chenaanah, made for himself horns of iron, and he said: â€œThus says the Lord: With these, you shall threaten Syria, until you crush it.
And all the prophets prophesied similarly, and they said: â€œAscend against Ramoth Gilead, and you shall prosper, and the Lord will deliver them into the hand of the king.

Then the messenger who had gone to summon Micaiah said to him: â€œLo, the words of all the prophets, with one mouth, announce good to the king. Therefore, I ask you that you not dissent from them in your word, and that you speak prosperity.
And Micaiah responded to him, â€œAs the Lord lives, whatever my God will say to me, the same shall I speak.

Therefore, he went to the king. And the king said to him, â€œMicaiah, should we go to war against Ramoth Gilead, or should we be quieted?â€ And he responded to him: â€œAscend. For everything will come to prosperity, and the enemies will be delivered into your hands.
And the king said, â€œAgain and again, I bind you by an oath, so that you will not speak to me except what is true in the name of the Lord!
Then he said: â€œI saw all of Israel scattered amid the mountains, like sheep without a shepherd. And the Lord said: â€˜These have no masters. Let each one return in peace to his own house.â€™
And the king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat: â€œDid I not tell you that this one would not prophesy to me anything good, but only what is evil?
Then he said: â€œTherefore, listen to the word of the Lord. I saw the Lord sitting upon his throne, and the entire army of heaven was standing beside him, on the right and on the left
And the Lord said: â€˜Who will deceive Ahab, the king of Israel, so that he may ascend and fall at Ramoth Gilead?â€™ And when one spoke in one way, and another in another way
there came forward a spirit, and he stood before the Lord and said, â€˜I will deceive him.â€™ And the Lord said to him, â€˜In what way will you deceive him?
And he responded, â€˜I will go forth, and I will be a lying spirit in the mouth of all his prophets.â€™ And the Lord said: â€˜You will deceive and prevail. Go forth and do so.
Therefore now, behold: the Lord gave a lying spirit to the mouth of all your prophets, and the Lord has spoken evil about you.
Then Zedekiah, the son of Chenaanah, approached, and he struck Micaiah on the jaw, and he said: â€œIn what way did the Spirit of the Lord depart from me, so that he would speak to you?
And Micaiah said: â€œYou yourself shall see it, in that day, when you will enter a room within a room, so that you may be hidden.
Then the king of Israel instructed, saying: â€œTake Micaiah, and lead him to Amon, the leader of the city, and to Joash, the son of Amalech
And you shall say: â€˜Thus says the king: Send this man to prison, and give to him a little bread and a little water, until I return in peace.â€™
And Micaiah said, â€œIf you will have returned in peace, the Lord has not spoken by me.â€ And he said, â€œMay all the people listen.
And so, the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat, the king of Judah, ascended against Ramoth Gilead

And the king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat: â€œI will change my clothing, and in this way I will go into battle. But you should be clothed in your own garments.â€ And the king of Israel, having changed his clothing, went to war
Now the king of Syria had instructed the commanders of his horsemen, saying, â€œYou shall not fight against the least or the greatest, but only against the king of Israel.

And so, when the leaders of the horsemen had seen Jehoshaphat, they said, â€œThis one is the king of Israel.â€ And while fighting, they surrounded him. But he cried out to the Lord, and he assisted him, and he turned them away from him
For when the commanders of the horsemen had seen that he was not the king of Israel, they left him

Then it happened that one of the people shot an arrow indiscriminately, and it struck the king of Israel between the neck and the shoulder. And so he said to his chariot driver: â€œTurn your hand, and lead me away from the battle line. For I have been wounded.
And the fight ended on that day. But the king of Israel was standing in his chariot facing the Syrians, even until evening. And he died when the sun set
